function_reachability: Is there a call path from function 'printList' to function 'printf'?
Is it impossible for function 'swap' to reach function 'seep'?
Is it impossible for function 'swap' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'i < len' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i < len' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'child <= end' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'child <= end' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < len' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'child <= end' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'a (line 2)' affect subsequent computations?
Does the value assigned to 'b (line 2)' affect subsequent computations?
liveness: Does variable 'l (line 2)' remain in use at the end of function 'swap'?
Does variable 'b' remain in use at the end of function 'swap'?
dead_code: Can the statement 'while(child <= end) {' be considered dead code?
Can the program actually reach the statement: “l[a] = l[b];”?
